heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 09 November 2025, dropping 47.89mm of rain over the 144.8 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 34.3mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 3 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 0 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (195°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 27 January 2026 with a value of 128.2 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.3°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 131 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) and inside temperature (up 3.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 131.1m lower than yesterday, 81.0m higher than the past week, 87.8m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 530m minimum and 1993m maximum, with an average of 879.7m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 798.6m and 791.9m.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Showers, fog or low cloud is expected, and it’s dim outside. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
